author: Sangeetha Khandavel
text:
Reactions to news about Freedom 251, known as the world’s cheapest smartphone, has bordered on scepticism. While some have gone ahead and pre-booked the phone online, many are still surprised at the pricing strategy of Ringing Bells, which offers this phone at Rs. 251.

“This sounds too good to be true. But more surprising things have happened in business. Lets wait for the details,” said Vijay Babu Gandhi, co-founder of a startup firm in the city. Karthik Lakshminarasimman from Valasaravalkam, who works for a service industry, said he placed an order for Freedom 251 for his kid. “The server crashed on day one. I was able to pre-book on the second day (Friday),” he said.

Mr. Vijay K Bysani, Vice-President, Customer Services at Home Serve, said, “While we end up paying more than Rs. 400 for a good-quality mobile scratch guard for our mobile phone, it is unbelievable to see Ringing Bells launching Freedom 251 at just Rs. 251.”

But he feels that if this takes off, it can help millions who are unconnected. If it delivers on its promises, this phone can be a game-changer in the market which is flooded with several phones that have similar tech specifications. The CEO of a mobile retail firm said, “I won’t buy this news till the product is released in June. Hope this is not a bubble,” he said.
title: Freedom 251, the world’s cheapest phone, evokes surprise
